I said: So he fulfilled my need, then he said: 'Clear the back of our mount for us.'

english_translation: From Hamdan, he narrated from Ali and Abdullah, and he was noble/distinguished. He was the one whom al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib sent with Muhammad ibn al-Ash'ath ibn Qais in the peace settlement between him and Mu'awiyah. Mu'awiyah was amazed at what he saw of Amr's eloquence and bearing. He asked: 'Are you a Persian?' He replied: 'No.' Then he recited poetry about his genealogy: 'I am from a people whom Allah built their glory upon every journey and place....' He said: 'I am a man from Hamdan, then from the Arhab,' and he was reliable and transmitted few hadiths.
